meanings.definition: Jackrolls (noun): a cylindrical tool used for lifting heavy objects
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a jackrolls to lift the car.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to always use a jackrolls when lifting heavy items.
meanings.sent3: The jackrolls decided to take a break after lifting so many heavy things.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a reliable jackrolls, always ready to lift her spirits.
meanings.sent5: The shiny jackrolls gleamed in the sunlight as it effortlessly lifted the heavy load.

meanings.definition: Jackrolls (verb): to lift or move something using a jackrolls
meanings.sent1: He carefully jackrolls the piano to the other side of the room.
meanings.sent2: Remember to always jackrolls with your legs, not your back.
meanings.sent3: The movers jackrolls the furniture into the new house with ease.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to jackrolls the heavy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The crane jackrolls the containers onto the ship with precision and skill.

meanings.definition: Jackrolls (adjective): relating to or characteristic of a jackrolls
meanings.sent1: The jackrolls handle was sturdy and reliable.
meanings.sent2: She admired the jackrolls design for its efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The jackrolls-themed party was a big hit with all the guests.
